algorithm_technique: Direct comparison of row and column characters
problem_summary_simple: Determine if a list of words forms a square where rows and columns read the same.
problem_summary_technical: Compare characters at (i, j) and (j, i) for all valid indices, ensuring row and column symmetry.
key_insights: The core idea is symmetry: word[i][j] must equal word[j][i].
Handle cases where rows or columns might be shorter than expected.
The comparison needs to be robust against out-of-bounds access.
